get.summary: Return the next 20 departures (or less if not existing) from a given point in time or the next departures in a given timespan.
get.description: This method will return the next 20 departures (or less if not existing) from a given point in time or the next departures in a given timespan. The service can only be called for stops/stations by using according ID retrieved by the location method. The parameter is called id. The time and date are defined with the parameters date and time.

parameters.description: stop id
parameters.name: id

parameters.description: the date
parameters.name: date

parameters.description: the time in format HH:MM
parameters.name: time

parameters.description: to exclude trips with Västtågen, set this parameter to 0.
parameters.name: useVas

parameters.description: to exclude trips with long distance trains, set this parameter to 0.
parameters.name: useLDTrain

parameters.description: to exclude trips with regional trains, set this parameter to 0.
parameters.name: useRegTrain

parameters.description: to exclude trips with buses, set this parameter to 0.
parameters.name: useBus

parameters.description: to exclude trips with boats, set this parameter to 0.
parameters.name: useBoat

parameters.description: to exclude trips with trams, set this parameter to 0.
parameters.name: useTram

parameters.description: to exclude journeys which require tel. registration, set this parameter to 0.
parameters.name: excludeDR

parameters.description: to get the next departures in a specified timespan of up to 24 hours (unit: minutes). If this parameter is not set, the result will contain the next 20 departures.
parameters.name: timeSpan

parameters.description: if timeSpan is set you can further reduce the number of returned journeys by adding this parameter, which will cause only the given number of journeys for every combination of line and direction.
parameters.name: maxDeparturesPerLine

parameters.description: if the reference URL for the journey detail service is not needed in the result, set this parameter to 0
parameters.name: needJourneyDetail

parameters.description: stop id in order to get only departures of vehicles with a specified direction
parameters.name: direction

parameters.description: the required response format
parameters.name: format

parameters.description: If JSONP response format is needed, you can append an additional parameter to specify the name of a callback function, and the JSON object will be wrapped by a function call with this name.
parameters.name: jsonpCallback

get.summary: Returns information about the complete route of a trip.
get.description: Delivers information about the complete route of a trip. This service can not be called directly but only by reference URLs in a result of a trip or departureBoard request. It contains a list of all stops/stations of this journey including all departure and arrival times (with real-time data if available) and additional information like specific attributes about facilities and other texts.

parameters.description: the ref query parameter, URL decoded, from a URL retrieved as a result of a trip or or departureBoard request
parameters.name: ref

get.summary: Returns the address nearest a given coordinate.

parameters.description: latitude of coordinate in the WGS84 system
parameters.name: originCoordLat

parameters.description: longitude of coordinate in the WGS84 system
parameters.name: originCoordLong

parameters.description: the required response format
parameters.name: format

parameters.description: If JSONP response format is needed, you can append an additional parameter to specify the name of a callback function, and the JSON object will be wrapped by a function call with this name.
parameters.name: jsonpCallback

get.summary: Provides information about the journey planner and the underlying data
get.description: Provides information about the journey planner and underlying data. It will return the begin of end of the timetable period and the creation date of the timetable data.

parameters.description: the required response format
parameters.name: format

parameters.description: If JSONP response format is needed, you can append an additional parameter to specify the name of a callback function, and the JSON object will be wrapped by a function call with this name.
parameters.name: jsonpCallback

get.summary: Calculates a trip from a specified origin to a specified destination.
get.description: Calculates a trip from a specified origin to a specified destination. These might be stop/station IDs or coordinates based on addresses and points of interest validated by the location service or coordinates freely defined by the client. Parameters specifying both origin and destination are mandatory in calls to the trip service. When specifying a stop as origin, the parameter originId is used, while originCoordLat, originCoordLong, and originCoordName are used to specify a (named) coordinate. For the destination, the corresponding parameters are named either destId or destCoordLat, destCoordLong and destCoordName. It is also possible to define a via-stop/station. This forces the journey planner to search for trips which pass the defined station. The parameter is called viaId. When searching for a trip that goes via a coordinate, rather than a stop, two separate trip requests need to be combined into one.

parameters.description: origin stop id
parameters.name: originId

parameters.description: origin latitude of center coordinate in the WGS84 system
parameters.name: originCoordLat

parameters.description: origin longitude of center coordinate in the WGS84 system
parameters.name: originCoordLong

parameters.description: name of the address at the specified origin coordinate
parameters.name: originCoordName

parameters.description: destination stop id
parameters.name: destId

parameters.description: destination latitude of center coordinate in the WGS84 system
parameters.name: destCoordLat

parameters.description: destination longitude of center coordinate in the WGS84 system
parameters.name: destCoordLong

parameters.description: name of the address at the specified destination coordinate
parameters.name: destCoordName

parameters.description: via stop/station id
parameters.name: viaId

parameters.description: date of the trip
parameters.name: date

parameters.description: time of the trip in format HH:MM
parameters.name: time

parameters.description: to specify that the given time and date is not the departure time but the latest time to arrive at the destination, set this parameter to the value 1.
parameters.name: searchForArrival

parameters.description: to exclude trips with Västtågen, set this parameter to 0.
parameters.name: useVas

parameters.description: to exclude trips with long distance trains, set this parameter to 0.
parameters.name: useLDTrain

parameters.description: to exclude trips with regional trains, set this parameter to 0.
parameters.name: useRegTrain

parameters.description: to exclude trips with buses, set this parameter to 0.
parameters.name: useBus

parameters.description: to include medical transport lines trips with buses, set this parameter to 1.
parameters.name: useMedical

parameters.description: to search for medical transport connections from the origin, set this parameter to 1.
parameters.name: originMedicalCon

parameters.description: to search for medical transport connections from the destination, set this parameter to 1.
parameters.name: destMedicalCon

parameters.description: to search for trips where at least one wheelchair space is present in the vehicle, set this parameter to 1.
parameters.name: wheelChairSpace

parameters.description: to search for trips with space for stroller, baby carriage or rollator in the vehicle, set this parameter to 1.
parameters.name: strollerSpace

parameters.description: to search for trips where the vehicle is equipped with a low floor section, but not necessarily a ramp or lift, set this parameter to 1.
parameters.name: lowFloor

parameters.description: to search for trips where the vehicle is equipped with ramp or lift that allows fully barrier-free boarding and alighting, set this parameter to 1.
parameters.name: rampOrLift

parameters.description: to exclude trips with boats, set this parameter to 0.
parameters.name: useBoat

parameters.description: to exclude trips with trams, set this parameter to 0.
parameters.name: useTram

parameters.description: to exclude trips with public transportation, set this parameter to 0.
parameters.name: usePT

parameters.description: to exclude journeys which require tel. registration, set this parameter to 1.
parameters.name: excludeDR

parameters.description: maximum walking distance from/to the coordinate in meters
parameters.name: maxWalkDist

parameters.description: walking speed given in percent of normal speed
parameters.name: walkSpeed

parameters.description: to exclude trips with walks from/to coordinates, set this to 0
parameters.name: originWalk

parameters.description: to exclude trips with walks from/to coordinates, set this to 0
parameters.name: destWalk

parameters.description: to search for walk-only trips, set this to 1
parameters.name: onlyWalk

parameters.description: to search for trips with a bike ride from the origin to a nearby stop, where the journey continues using public transport, set this to 1.
parameters.name: originBike

parameters.description: maximum biking distance from/to the coordinate in meters
parameters.name: maxBikeDist

parameters.description: optimize for either the fastest route or a route that is made up of a larger percentage of bike road, where 'F' is used to indicate tha fastest route with mimimized travel time, and 'D' is used to indicate dedicated bike roads to maximize use of bike roads.
parameters.name: bikeCriterion

parameters.description: determines the altitude profile of the route, based on a setting for how fast the user can bike when it is steep, where 'E' is used to indicate easy with minimized steepnes, 'N' is used to indicate normal, and 'P' is used to indicate powerful to allow more steepness.
parameters.name: bikeProfile

parameters.description: to search for bike-only trips, set this to 1
parameters.name: onlyBike

parameters.description: to search for trips where customer travels by car from the origin and is dropped off at a stop to continue the trip using public transport, set this to 1.
parameters.name: originCar

parameters.description: to search for trips where the customer travels by car from the origin, parks at a commuter parking and walks to a nearby stop to continue the trip using public transport, set this to 1.
parameters.name: originCarWithParking

parameters.description: maximum car distance from/to the coordinate in meters
parameters.name: maxCarDist

parameters.description: to search for car-only trips, set this to 1
parameters.name: onlyCar

parameters.description: maximum number of changes in the trip
parameters.name: maxChanges

parameters.description: to prolong the minimal change times in minutes between the public transport legs of the returned journeys
parameters.name: additionalChangeTime

parameters.description: to ignore the default change margin, set this to 1
parameters.name: disregardDefaultChangeMargin

parameters.description: if the reference URL for the journey detail service is not needed in the re, set this to 0
parameters.name: needJourneyDetail

parameters.description: if a reference link for each leg of the resulting trips, which can be used to request the geometry, is needed, set this to 1
parameters.name: needGeo

parameters.description: if a reference link for each leg of the resulting trips, which can be used to request the itinerary, is needed, set this to 1
parameters.name: needItinerary

parameters.description: the number of trips in the returned result
parameters.name: numTrips

parameters.description: the required response format
parameters.name: format

parameters.description: If JSONP response format is needed, you can append an additional parameter to specify the name of a callback function, and the JSON object will be wrapped by a function call with this name.
parameters.name: jsonpCallback

get.summary: Returns the positions of all vehicles in a given bounding box
get.description: This method will return the positions of all vehicles in a given bounding box.

parameters.description: Left border (longitude) of the bounding box in WGS84 * 1000000
parameters.name: minx

parameters.description: Right border (longitude) of the bounding box in WGS84 * 1000000
parameters.name: maxx

parameters.description: Lower border (latitude) of the bounding box in WGS84 * 1000000
parameters.name: miny

parameters.description: Upper border (latitude) of the bounding box in WGS84 * 1000000
parameters.name: maxy

parameters.description: Can be used to define whether all vehicles should be returned or only those  vehicles which have realtime information. If it is set to yes, only vehicles  with realtime information are returned, if it is set to no, all vehicles in the  bounding box are returned.
parameters.name: onlyRealtime

get.summary: Return the next 20 arrivals (or less if not existing) from a given point in time or the next arrivals in a given timespan.
get.description: This method will return the next 20 arrivals (or less if not existing) from a given point in time or the next arrivals in a given timespan. The service can only be called for stops/stations by using according ID retrieved by the location method. The parameter is called id. The time and date are defined with the parameters date and time.

parameters.description: stop id
parameters.name: id

parameters.description: the date
parameters.name: date

parameters.description: the time in format HH:MM
parameters.name: time

parameters.description: to exclude trips with Västtågen, set this parameter to 0.
parameters.name: useVas

parameters.description: to exclude trips with long distance trains, set this parameter to 0.
parameters.name: useLDTrain

parameters.description: to exclude trips with regional trains, set this parameter to 0.
parameters.name: useRegTrain

parameters.description: to exclude trips with buses, set this parameter to 0.
parameters.name: useBus

parameters.description: to exclude trips with boats, set this parameter to 0.
parameters.name: useBoat

parameters.description: to exclude trips with trams, set this parameter to 0.
parameters.name: useTram

parameters.description: to exclude journeys which require tel. registration, set this parameter to 0.
parameters.name: excludeDR

parameters.description: to get the next departures in a specified timespan of up to 24 hours (unit: minutes). If this parameter is not set, the result will contain the next 20 departures.
parameters.name: timeSpan

parameters.description: if timeSpan is set you can further reduce the number of returned journeys by adding this parameter, which will cause only the given number of journeys for every combination of line and direction.
parameters.name: maxDeparturesPerLine

parameters.description: if the reference URL for the journey detail service is not needed in the result, set this parameter to 0
parameters.name: needJourneyDetail

parameters.description: stop id in order to get only departures of vehicles with a specified direction
parameters.name: direction

parameters.description: the required response format
parameters.name: format

get.summary: Returns a list of stops around a given center coordinate.
get.description: Returns a list of stops around a given center coordinate. The returned results are ordered by their distance to the center coordinate.

parameters.description: latitude of center coordinate in the WGS84 system
parameters.name: originCoordLat

parameters.description: longitude of center coordinate in the WGS84 system
parameters.name: originCoordLong

parameters.description: maximum number of returned stops
parameters.name: maxNo

parameters.description: maximum distance from the center coordinate
parameters.name: maxDist

parameters.description: the required response format
parameters.name: format

parameters.description: If JSONP response format is needed, you can append an additional parameter to specify the name of a callback function, and the JSON object will be wrapped by a function call with this name.
parameters.name: jsonpCallback

get.summary: Returns a list of all stops available in the journey planner.
get.description: Returns a list of all stops available in the journey planner. Be aware that a call of this service is very time consuming and should be only requested when it is really needed.

parameters.description: the required response format
parameters.name: format

parameters.description: If JSONP response format is needed, you can append an additional parameter to specify the name of a callback function, and the JSON object will be wrapped by a function call with this name.
parameters.name: jsonpCallback

get.summary: Returns the polyline for a leg.
get.description: Returns the polyline for a leg. This service can not be called directly but only by reference URLs in a result of a trip or JourneyDetail request. The result contains a list of WGS84 coordinates which can be used to display the polyline on a map.If the parameter needItinerary=1 is passed in the URL of the trip request that contained the reference to the Geometry service, the geometry reference link will also contain an itinerary for walk, bike and car legs, that can be used to generate turn-by-turn instructions.

parameters.description: the ref query parameter, URL decoded, from a URL retrieved as a result of a trip or JourneyDetail request
parameters.name: ref

get.summary: Returns a list of possible matches in the journey planner database
get.description: Performs a pattern matching of a user input to retrieve a list of possible matches in the journey planner database. Possible matches might be stops/stations, points of interest and addresses.

parameters.description: a string with the user input
parameters.name: input

parameters.description: the required response format
parameters.name: format

parameters.description: If JSONP response format is needed, you can append an additional parameter to specify the name of a callback function, and the JSON object will be wrapped by a function call with this name.
parameters.name: jsonpCallback

servertime.description: Current server time in format HH:MM

stop.description: Contains the name of the stop/station

booking.description: Will be true if this journey needs to be booked

type.description: The attribute type specifies the type of the departing journey. Valid values are VAS, LDT (Long Distance Train), REG (Regional train), BUS , BOAT, TRAM, TAXI (Taxi/Telebus)

rtDate.description: Realtime date in format YYYY-MM-DD, if available

name.description: The attribute name specifies the name of the departing journey

rtTime.description: Realtime time in format HH:MM if available

night.description: Will be true if this journey is a night journey

stopid.description: Contains the id of the stop/station

journeyid.description: Contains the id of the journey

accessibility.description: will only be set if the vehicle has wheelchair + ramp/lift or lowfloor according to realtime data

servertime.description: Current server time in format HH:MM

routeIdx.description: Route index of a stop/station. Can be used as a reference of the stop/station in a journeyDetail response

cancelled.description: Will be set to true if departure/arrival at this stop is cancelled

type.description: The attribute type specifies the type of location. Valid values are ST (stop/station), ADR (address) or POI (point of interest)

rtDate.description: Realtime date in format YYYY-MM-DD, if available

directdate.description: Date in format YYYY-MM-DD.  Based on the direct travel time

name.description: Contains the name of the location

rtTime.description: Realtime time in format HH:MM if available

directtime.description: Direct Time format HH:MM. Based on the direct travel time

servertime.description: Current server time in format HH:MM

routeIdx.description: Route index of a stop/station. Can be used as a reference of the stop/station in a journeyDetail response

arrDate.description: Arrival date in format YYYY-MM-DD, if available

depTime.description: Departure time in format HH:MM, if available

depDate.description: Departure date in format YYYY-MM-DD, if available

rtDepTime.description: Realtime departure time in format HH:MM if available

rtArrTime.description: Realtime arrival time in format HH:MM if available

name.description: Contains the name of the stop/station

arrTime.description: Arrival time in format HH:MM, if available

rtDepDate.description: Realtime departure date in format YYYY-MM-DD, if available

rtArrDate.description: Realtime arrival date in format YYYY-MM-DD, if available

routeIdxTo.description: End of validity on total route

routeIdxFrom.description: Start of validity on total route

travelWarranty.description: IMPORTANT NOTE: journeys that are presented when the default change margin has been disregarded are not covered by V�sttrafiks travel warranty (Swedish: resegaranti).

valid.description: The state indicates if the trip is still possible to ride based on the current realtime situation

alternative.description: The type indicates whether this is an original connection or an realtime alternative

ref.description: Contains a URL to call the REST interface for geometry

servertime.description: Current server time in format HH:MM

stop.description: Contains the name of the stop/station

booking.description: Will be true if this journey needs to be booked

type.description: The attribute type specifies the type of the arriving journey. Valid values are VAS, LDT (Long Distance Train), REG (Regional train), BUS , BOAT, TRAM, TAXI (Taxi/Telebus)

rtDate.description: Realtime date in format YYYY-MM-DD, if available

name.description: The attribute name specifies the name of the arriving journey

rtTime.description: Realtime time in format HH:MM if available

night.description: Will be true if this journey is a night journey

stopid.description: Contains the id of the stop/station

journeyid.description: Contains the id of the journey

accessibility.description: will only be set if the vehicle has wheelchair + ramp/lift or lowfloor according to realtime data

servertime.description: Current server time in format HH:MM

direction.description: Direction of the vehicle. This is a value between 0 and 31 which is describing a direction vector

delay.description: Current delay of the vehicle in minutes, can be negative, zero or positive

y.description: Y coordinate (latitude) of the position in WGS84 * 1000000

x.description: X coordinate (longitude) of the position in WGS84 * 1000000

servertime.description: Current server time in format HH:MM

ref.description: Contains a URL to call the REST interface for journey details

priority.description: Priority of the note which can be used to order the notes in the list.

severity.description: Severity of this note, can be high, normal or low

$.description: Creation date of timetable data in format YYYY-MM-DD

idx.description: This index can be used to reorder the StopLocations and CoordLocations in JSON format response to their correct order. IN JSON you can receive two arrays, one for Stops and one for Addresses. This attribute is only contained in reponses to the location.name request. The location with idx=1 is the best fitting location.

name.description: Contains the output name of the address or point of interest

type.description: The attribute type specifies the type of location. Valid values are ADR (address) or POI (point of interest). This attribute can be used to do some sort of classification in the user interface. For later trip requests it does not have any meaning.

routeIdxTo.description: End of validity on total route.

routeIdxFrom.description: Start of validity on total route

booking.description: Will be true if this journey needs to be booked

cancelled.description: Will be true if this journey is cancelled

type.description: The attribute type specifies the type of the leg. Valid values are VAS, LDT (Long Distance Train), REG (Regional train), BUS , BOAT, TRAM, TAXI (Taxi/Telebus). Furthermore it can be of type WALK, BIKE and CAR if these legs are routes on the street network

reachable.description: Will be true if this journey is not reachable due to delay of the feeder

name.description: The attribute name specifies the name of the leg

night.description: Will be true if this journey is a night journey

percentBikeRoad.description: Percentage of the route that is made up of bike roads

accessibility.description: will only be set if the vehicle has wheelchair + ramp/lift or lowfloor according to realtime data

routeIdxTo.description: End of validity on total route.

routeIdxFrom.description: Start of validity on total route

type.description: The attribute type specifies the type of the journey. Valid values are VAS, LDT (Long Distance Train), REG (Regional train), BUS , BOAT, TRAM, TAXI (Taxi/Telebus)

$.description: Begin of timetable period in format YYYY-MM-DD

maxx.description: Right border (longitude) of the bounding box in WGS84 * 1000000

maxy.description: Upper border (latitude) of the bounding box in WGS84 * 1000000

minx.description: Left border (longitude) of the bounding box in WGS84 * 1000000

miny.description: Lower border (latitude) of the bounding box in WGS84 * 1000000

id.description: This ID can either be used as originId or destId to perform a trip request or to call a departure  board

idx.description: This index can be used to reorder the StopLocations and CoordLocations in JSON format response to their correct order. IN JSON you can receive two arrays, one for Stops and one for Addresses. This attribute is only contained in reponses to the location.name request. The location with idx=1 is the best fitting location

weight.description: This value specifies some kind of importance of this stop. The more traffic at this stop the higher the weight. The range is between 0 and 32767. This attribute is just contained in the location.allstops response

name.description: Contains the output name of this stop or station

servertime.description: Current server time in format HH:MM

$.description: End of timetable period in format YYYY-MM-DD

routeIdxTo.description: End of validity on total route

routeIdxFrom.description: Start of validity on total route

routeIdx.description: Route index of a stop/station. Can be used as a reference of the stop/station in a journeyDetail response

cancelled.description: Will be set to true if departure/arrival at this stop is cancelled

type.description: The attribute type specifies the type of location. Valid values are ST (stop/station), ADR (address) or POI (point of interest)

rtDate.description: Realtime date in format YYYY-MM-DD, if available

directdate.description: Date in format YYYY-MM-DD.  Based on the direct travel time

name.description: Contains the name of the location

rtTime.description: Realtime time in format HH:MM if available

directtime.description: Direct Time format HH:MM. Based on the direct travel time

info.title: Reseplaneraren
info.description: Provides access to Västtrafik journey planner
